thread.title: Grammys 2017: Twenty One Pilots Win Best Pop Duo/Group Performance | Pitchfork
thread.title_full: Grammys 2017: Twenty One Pilots Win Best Pop Duo/Group Performance | Pitchfork

title: Grammys 2017: Twenty One Pilots Win Best Pop Duo/Group Performance | Pitchfork
text:
42 mins ago Grammys 2017: Twenty One Pilots Win Best Pop Duo/Group Performance “Stressed Out” beat out Drake and Rihanna, Sia and Sean Paul, the Chainsmokers and Halsey, and Lukas Graham Photo by Kevin Winter/Getty Images for NARAS 
Twenty One Pilots have won Best Pop Duo/Group Performance at the 59th Annual Grammy Awards . “Stressed Out” picked up the victory over songs by Sia and Sean Paul, the Drake and Rihanna, the Chainsmokers and Halsey, and Lukas Graham. “Stressed Out” is also nominated for Record of the Year. The band also received nominations for Best Rock Song and Best Rock Performance for “Heathens.” Tyler Joseph and Josh Dun accepted the award pantsless, explaining to the crowd that they swore to themselves in the past that they’d do so if they ever made it to the Grammy stage—find their speech below. 
For more of Pitchfork’s coverage of this year’s Grammy Awards, click here . Tags In This Story
